one: The ancient traditions of worship and sacrifice must be preserved and upheld.
two: I always try to help those in need, no matter what the personal cost.
three: We must help bring about the changes the gods are constantly working in the world.
four: I hope to one day rise to the top of my faith's religious hierarchy.
five: I trust that my deity will guide my actions. I have faith that if I work hard, things will go well.
six: I seek to prove myself worthy of my god's favor by matching my actions against his or her teachings.

one: I am a free spirit - no one tells me what to do.
two: I never target people who can't afford to lose a few coins.
three: I distribute the money I acquire to the people who really need it.
four: I never run the same con twice.
five: Material goods come and go. Bonds of friendship last forever.
six: I'm determined to make something of myself.

one: I don't steal from others in the trade.
two: Chains are meant to be broken, as are those who would forge them.
three: I steal from the wealthy so that I can help people in need.
four: I will do whatever it takes to become wealthy.
five: I'm loyal to my friends, not to any ideals, and everyone else can take a trip down the Styx for all I care.
six: There's a spark of good in everyone.

one: When I perform, I make the world better than it was.
two: The stories, legends, and songs of the past must never be forgotten, for they teach us who we are.
three: The world is in need of new ideas and bold actions.
four: I'm only in it for the money and fame.
five: I like seeing the smiles on people's faces when I perform. That's all that matters.
six: Art should reflect the soul; it should come from within and reveal who we really are.

one: People deserve to be treated with dignity and respect.
two: No one should get preferential treatment before the law, and no one is above the law.
three: Tyrants must not be allowed to oppress the people.
four: If I become strong, I can take what I want - what I deserve.
five: There's no good in pretending to be something I'm not.
six: Nothing and no one can steer me away from my higher calling.

one: It is the duty of all civilized people to strengthen the bonds of community and the security of civilization.
two: My talents were given to me so that I could use them to benefit the world.
three: Everyone should be free to pursue his or her own livelihood.
four: I'm only in it for the money.
five: I'm committed to the people I care about, not to ideals.
six: I work hard to be the best there is at my craft.

one: My gifts are meant to be shared with all, not used for my own benefit.
two: Emotions must not cloud our sense of what is right and true, or our logical thinking.
three: Inquiry and curiosity are the pillars of progress.
four: Solitude and contemplation are paths toward mystical or magical power.
five: Meddling in the affairs of others only causes trouble.
six: If you know yourself, there's nothing left to know.

one: Respect is due to me because of my position, but all people regardless of station deserve to be treated with dignity.
two: It is my duty to respect the authority of those above me, just as those below me must respect mine.
three: I must prove that I can handle myself without the coddling of my family.
four: If I can attain more power, no one will tell me what to do.
six: It is my duty to protect and care for the people beneath me.

one: Life is like the seasons, in constant change, and we must change with it.
two: It is each person's responsibility to make the most happiness for the whole tribe.
three: If I dishonor myself, I dishonor my whole clan.
four: The strongest are meant to rule.
five: The natural world is more important than all the constructs of civilization.
six: I must earn glory in battle, for myself and my clan.

one: The path to power and self-improvement is through knowledge.
two: What is beautiful points us beyond itself toward what is true.
three: Emotions must not cloud our logical thinking.
four: Nothing should fetter the infinite possibility inherent in all existence.
five: Knowledge is the path to power and domination.
six: The goal of a life of study is the betterment of oneself.

one: The thing that keeps a ship together is mutual respect between captain and crew.
two: We all do the work, so we all share in the rewards.
three: The sea is freedom - the freedom to go anywhere and do anything.
four: I'm a predator, and the other ships on the sea are my prey.
five: I'm committed to my cremates, not to ideals.
six: Someday I'll own my own ship and chart my own destiny.

one: Our lot is to lay down our lives in defense of others.
two: I do what I must and obey just authority.
three: When people follow orders blindly, they embrace a kind of tyranny.
four: In life as in war, the stronger force wins.
five: Ideals aren't worth killing over or going to war for.
six: My city, nation, or people are all that matter.

one: All people, rich or poor, deserve respect.
two: We have to take care of each other, because no one else is going to do it.
three: The low are lifted up, and the high and mighty are brought down. Change is the nature of things.
four: The rich need to be shown what life and death are like in the gutters.
five: I help the people who help me - that's what keeps us alive.
six: I'm going to prove that I'm worthy of a better life.
